abstract.p: Photos of several bright outfits seen in New York City (On the Street column)

block.p: Some New Yorkers slipcovered themselves in sunny yellow, an optimistic approach to two relentlessly gray weeks of rain. Dandies on Fifth Avenue wore yellow Dick Tracy hats that matched their suits. Kevin Berlin, a sculptor, chose a T-shirt and jeans printed with giant lemons. A posse of Hamptons road warriors sported parrot-yellow bikes and matching helmets. And Madeline escaped the gloomy weather by trading her traditional blue coat for a yellow one.
